creator: gerhard.oettl@oesoft.at
text:
in the rare case when the *very* last inline object is a footnote-marker (and
may be the previous footnote-body is long) the footnote-body of the last
footnote is moved to the next page and the footnote-marker in the
footnote-region is lost. The word to which the footnote belonges is on page 7
the footnote-body itself on page 8.

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
The fact that the footnote-body is moved to the next page is in itself not an error, this may happen if 
there is not enough space left on the current page. Undesirable, maybe, but compliant nonetheless...

Thanks for supplying the testcase, but from where I'm sitting, this simply looks like a case of the first 
footnote being moved partly to the next page. There is no requirement in this case to repeat the marker, I 
believe.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
